generalInfo:
Immerse yourself in Belize’s vibrant rainforests, rich history, and turquoise waters on this tailor-made adventure. From jungle expeditions and ancient Maya mysteries to idyllic island-hopping aboard a private catamaran, this journey is an exhilarating blend of exploration and relaxation. This trip is designed to suit an intergenerational family group, or a vacation for a group of friends, but can be tailored to suit a family or couple.

Begin in Belize’s lush Cayo District with a serene jungle pontoon boat ride. Drift along untouched rivers, spot vibrant wildlife, and swim beneath secluded waterfalls.

Paddle into the Barton Creek Cave, an ancient Maya ceremonial site, where impressive stalactites and hidden chambers tell stories of a bygone era. Later, cross the Mopan River on a hand-cranked ferry to Xunantunich, a hilltop Maya city. Climb El Castillo, a towering pyramid offering panoramic views of jungle-clad landscapes.

Actun Tunichil Muknal is one of the world’s most awe-inspiring sacred caves. Wade through streams, navigate narrow passages, and discover ancient pottery, artifacts, and skeletal remains. This combination of archaeology and adventure offers a deep dive into Maya history and culture.

Board your sleek private catamaran for an all-inclusive sailing adventure along Belize’s Caribbean coastline. The cayes, a tropical paradise of over 400 islands, beckon with vibrant marine life, pristine reefs, and crystal-clear waters.

Snorkel at Hol Chan Marine Reserve, spot rays at Shark Ray Alley, or unwind at laid-back Caye Caulker with fresh seafood and breezy beach bars. Dive into South Water Caye’s pristine reefs or kayak through the mangrove channels of Bluefield Range. Swim with dolphins, spot manatees and explore the coral island of Tobacco Caye, or relax with a cold drink at Goff’s Caye.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN BELIZE - On arrival at Belize City International Airport, you will be met and privately transferred by road to the Cayo District, a drive of around 2 hours. Rugged and remote, the Cayo District is a vast stretch of highland rainforests, cattle ranches, and pinelands. Located in western Belize and bordering Guatemala's El Petén region, explore the great outdoors on foot, by horse, or via kayak, raft, or canoe. Belize's oldest and largest national park - Mountain Pine Ridge Forest Reserve - offers caves to explore, cool rivers for swimming, and a seemingly endless forest that is home to myriad tropical birds. The real hub of the district is San Ignacio, a small town featuring rustic, colonial-era streets, an eclectic mix of restaurants and shops and a lively weekly market.

JUNGLE PONTOON BOAT RIDE & WATERFALL SWIMMING; TREK ANCIENT SACRED CAVE PASSAGES: Explore the lush Cayo District on a serene pontoon boat ride through Belize’s rainforest. Drift along jungle rivers, spot wildlife, and swim in secluded waterfalls cascading into pristine pools. Perfect for nature lovers seeking a peaceful escape and breathtaking views of untouched Belizean wilderness. This afternoon, embark on an exhilarating trek through Actun Tunichil Muknal Cave in Belize’s Cayo District. Wade through crystal-clear streams, navigate cave passages, and encounter ancient Maya artifacts, pottery, and skeletal remains. Known as one of the world’s top sacred caves, this unique adventure blends archaeology, nature, and mystery for a truly unforgettable experience.

CANOE TO BARTON CREEK CAVES AND EXPLORE XUANTUNICH RUINS: Paddle into the mystic Barton Creek Cave on a guided morning canoe tour. Journey through ancient Mayan waterways, marvel at impressive stalactites, and discover hidden chambers filled with history and natural beauty. Perfect for explorers looking to blend adventure with archaeology in a stunning cave setting. This afternoon, discover the ancient Mayan city of Xunantunich, perched atop a hill in Belize’s Cayo District. Cross the Mopan River by hand-cranked ferry, then explore impressive temples, plazas, and El Castillo, the towering pyramid offering breathtaking panoramic views. This journey through history and stunning jungle landscapes is ideal for history buffs and adventure seekers alike.

BOARD YOUR PRIVATE CATAMARAN TO ISLAND HOP THE CAYES OF BELIZE: Private transfer to Cucumber Beach Marina to board your catamarans. Indulge in this all-inclusive sailing adventure along the coast of Belize. Sail to St George’s Caye, steeped in history it was the first capital of the British settlement in Belize. The island is principally home to private families, however it is possible to use this as a base for some great snorkeling or scuba diving, or walking the sandy shores. Before anchorage enjoy a snorkel among the colourful corals and tropical fish of Gallow's Reef.

SAIL TO GOFF'S CAYE & BANNISTER: Sail to Goff’s Caye – one of our favourite islands because it reminds us why postcards were invented. This 2-acre island sits right on the barrier reef so you can snorkel straight from the shore, or simply relax in the water on the sandbar. Sail up to Bannister Bogue, a mangrove collection of islands that are home to manatees, dolphins, multiple bird species and other marine life. Manatees, which are also known as ‘sea cows’ are gentle, slow moving, plant-eating herbivores and their closest living relatives are elephants and aardvarks. They can grow over 13 feet in length and weigh up to 3,500 pounds. Despite being an endangered species, manatees are present in the waters of Belize and can be seen throughout the year. (Please note it is not possible to swim with the Manatees and seeing them is not guaranteed).

SAIL TO CAYE CAULKER: Sail to the sleepy island of Caye Caulker and enjoy a swim on arrival. ‘No shirt, no shoes, no problem’ is the motto of this island and typifies the vibe. The white sandy beaches, ocean breezes, fresh seafood, azure waters and a fantastic barrier reef on its doorstep make it a perfect place to relax and unwind. A trip to Caye Caulker is not complete without a late afternoon Belikin beer or a rum punch at the Lazy Lizard bar at ‘The Cut’ – a lively swimming area, which separates the two islands of Caye Caulker.

SNORKEL AT HOL CHAN MARINE RESERVE & SHARK ALLEY: Enjoy a morning of snorkelling right off the catamaran at Hol Chan Marine Reserve, swimming amongst beautiful shoals of tropical fish, turtles, eagle rays, stingrays, moray eels and grouper. Return to the boat and re-charge the batteries over a tropical lunch with the reef only meters from your anchorage. Follow this with a dip at Shark Ray Alley, a site where local fishermen used to clean their catch, which attracts more carnivorous species such as big southern stingrays and nurse sharks. For PADI certified divers wanting to make a difference, embark on an afternoon of helping to reduce an invasive species, detrimental to the indigenous species, by spearing lionfish with a certified instructor.

RETURN TO BELIZE CITY TO FLY HOME Enjoy breakfast and a leisurely morning before disembarking at 11am and heading to Belize International Airport for your flight back home, a drive of approx. 30 mins.
